org.bsc.bean
Interface BeanManager<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBeanManager, AggregateBeanManager
public interface BeanManager<T>

It's an implementation of DAO interface (see DAO pattern ) for a jdbc data source to define a bean persistent model based on a extension of BeanInfo meta data
Examples:


Connection conn =  open connection ... 

MyBean bean = new MyBean();

 set properties of bean 

// Create a bean manager instance that manage the MyBean persistence
BeanManager manager = (BeanManager)BeanManagerFactory.createBeanManager( MyBean.class );

//CREATE(INSERT) BEAN ON DB
manager.create( conn, bean );

//STORE(UPDATE) BEAN ON DB
manager.store( conn, bean );

//REMOVE (DELETE) BEAN ON DB
manager.remove( conn, id value );

//FIND (SELECT) BEAN BY ID ON DB

MyBean bean  = manager.findById( conn, id value );

//
//FIND (SELECT) BEAN(S) BY CONDITION ON DB
// APPROACH CURSOR BASED
BeanEnumeration result = manager.find( conn,  "${propertyName} LIKE ?", "FOR%" );

// FETCH BEANS
for( MyBean b : result ) {
                ......
}
result.close();

//
//FIND (SELECT) BEAN(S) BY CONDITION ON DB
// APPROACH CACHE BASED
List resultList = manager.find( conn, new List(), "${propertyName} LIKE ?", "FOR%" );

// GET BEANS
for( MyBean b : resultList ) {
                ......
}

conn.close();








See Also:
bsc.bean.PropertyDescriptorField, 
bsc.bean.BeanDescriptorEntity

 T
findById(java.sql.Connection conn,
         java.lang.Object... id)



          select bean from db using an primary key value
 Note:
 if you have a composite key must pass all key's values in right order (i.e. the same declared within BeanInfo)
 
 Ex.:
 SINGLE KEY (string)
 String id = "xxxxx";
 MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, id );
 MULTIPLE KEY (string,integer)
 MyBean bean = (MyBean)manager.findById( conn, "xxxx", 1 );

 int
store(java.sql.Connection conn,
      T bean,
      StoreConstraints constraints,
      java.lang.String... properties)



          update bean into db having the possibility of
 include/exclude properties into update command

 
 Ex.:
 int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, StoreConstraints.INCLUDE_PROPERTIES, "prop1",  "prop2, ..." ); // include
 OR
 int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, StoreConstraints.EXCLUDE_PROPERTIES, "prop1", "prop2", ...  ); // exclude

          update all rows using the property's values of the given bean having the possibility of
 include/exclude properties into update command

store


int store(java.sql.Connection conn,
          T bean,
          StoreConstraints constraints,
          java.lang.String... properties)
          throws java.sql.SQLException




update bean into db having the possibility of
 include/exclude properties into update command

 
 Ex.:
 int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, StoreConstraints.INCLUDE_PROPERTIES, "prop1",  "prop2, ..." ); // include
 OR
 int result = manager.store( conn, myBean, StoreConstraints.EXCLUDE_PROPERTIES, "prop1", "prop2", ...  ); // exclude
 






Parameters:
conn - database connection
bean - object to update into db
properties - properties to include/exclude to update
constraints - allow to include or exclude properties from update

Throws:

java.sql.SQLException

int removeById(java.sql.Connection conn,

delete bean from db using an id
 Note:
 if you have a composite key must pass all key's values in right order (i.e. the same declared within BeanInfo)
 
 Ex.:
 SINGLE KEY (string)
 String id = "xxxxx";
 manager.removeById( conn, id );
 MULTIPLE KEY (string,integer)
 manager.removeById( conn, "xxxx", 1 );
 






Parameters:
conn - database connection
id - primary key value(s)

Returns:
1 if success removed

Throws:

java.sql.SQLException

find


java.util.Collection<T> find(java.sql.Connection conn,
                             java.util.Collection<T> result,
                             java.lang.String where,
                             java.lang.Object... values)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException




 select beans from db using a where condition and cache the result into collection

 NB
 can close the connection before you use the collection
 






Parameters:
conn - database connection
result - instance of collection that will contains all the instance of beans
where - condition formatted like PreparedStatement
values - Object array contains a parameters value specified into where condition
                
create an entry for each ? into where condition

Returns:
collection that contains all the instance of beans ( same of result parameter )

Throws:

java.sql.SQLException
See Also:
java.sql.PreparedStetement










find


BeanEnumeration<T> find(java.sql.Connection conn,
                        java.lang.String where,
                        java.lang.Object... values)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException




 select beans from db using a where condition

  NB
  cannot close the connection before you have obtain all element from enumeration
  






Parameters:
conn - database connection
where - condition formatted like PreparedStatement
values - Object array contains a parameters value specified into where condition
                
create an entry for each ? into where condition

Returns:
enumeration of retreived beans

Throws:

java.sql.SQLException
See Also:
java.sql.PreparedStetement

findAll


java.util.Collection<T> findAll(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                java.util.Collection<T> result,
                                java.lang.String sqlClouse)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException




select all beans from db





Parameters:
conn - database connection
collection - used for store all the instance of bean
sqlClouse - sql clouse to append command ( like order by or group by ... ) cannot enter parameters can be null

Returns:
collection that contain all the instance of bean ( same of result parameter )

Throws:

java.sql.SQLException
